summary:
**Meeting Overview**: The Board of Adjustment (Panel B) of the City of Dallas will convene on January 17, 2024, with a briefing at 10:30 A.M. followed by a public hearing at 1:00 P.M. The meeting will take place at Dallas City Hall, Room 6ES, and will also be accessible via videoconference. The primary purpose is to address various zoning requests and adjustments submitted by residents and stakeholders.

**Key Agenda Items**: The meeting will include a staff presentation, public hearing, and public testimony. Key topics involve reviewing uncontested items, holdover cases, and individual case requests for variances and special exceptions related to zoning regulations.

**Important Details**: Significant proposals include requests for special exceptions to front-yard setbacks, landscaping regulations, parking regulations, and fence height and opacity standards. Notable cases include applications for variances at 1020 Comal Street, 4205 Duncanville Road, and 1874 Temper Road, among others. The agenda also includes a holdover case regarding a side-yard setback variance at 1914 Ashby Street.

**Action Items**: The Board seeks to approve the minutes from the previous meeting (December 13, 2023) and make decisions on the various applications presented, including special exceptions and variances. Public participation is encouraged, with interested parties required to register by January 16, 2024, to speak during the hearing.
